modules.title: Introduction to Cubit
modules.description: Get started with the Cubit language, its philosophy, and setup.

lessons.title: What is Cubit?
lessons.content: Cubit is a modern, educational programming language designed for learning and creativity. In this lesson, you'll learn about its goals, syntax, and unique features.

lessons.title: Setting Up Cubit
lessons.content: Learn how to install and run Cubit locally or in the cloud. Step-by-step instructions for different platforms.

lessons.title: Hello, World!
lessons.content:
Write your first Cubit program and see how code execution works. Example:

let message = 'Hello, World!'
print message

modules.title: Cubit Basics
modules.description: Learn the core syntax and concepts of Cubit.

lessons.title: Variables and Types
lessons.content:
Understand how to declare variables and use basic types in Cubit. Example:

let x = 5
let name = 'Alice'
print x
print name

lessons.title: Operators and Expressions
lessons.content:
Explore arithmetic, comparison, and logical operators. Example:

let a = 10
let b = 3
print a + b
print a > b

lessons.title: Control Flow

modules.title: Functions and Modules
modules.description: Write reusable code and organize your Cubit programs.

lessons.title: Defining Functions
Using Modules
lessons.content:
Import and use modules for math, strings, and more. Example:

import math
print math.sqrt(16)

modules.title: Advanced Cubit
modules.description: Explore advanced features and best practices.

lessons.title: Lists and Iteration
Error Handling
Project: Build a Countdown
lessons.content:
Apply your knowledge to build a countdown program in Cubit. Example:

let n = 5
while n > 0 {
  print n
  n = n - 1
}
print 'Liftoff!'
